dcterms:creator: Alex Krizhevsky
Geoffrey Hinton
dcterms:description: CIFAR-10 is a dataset consisting of 60,000 32x32 color images in 10 classes, with 6,000 images per class. It is commonly used for training machine learning models in image classification tasks.
dcterms:title: CIFAR-10

dcterms:creator: Alex Krizhevsky
Geoffrey Hinton
dcterms:description: CIFAR-100 is a dataset consisting of 60,000 32x32 color images in 100 classes, with 600 images per class. It is used for more fine-grained image classification tasks compared to CIFAR-10.
dcterms:title: CIFAR-100

dcterms:creator: Olga Russakovsky
Jia Deng
Hao Su
Jonathan Krause
Sanjeev Satheesh
Sean Ma
Zhiheng Huang
Andrej Karpathy
Aditya Khosla
Michael Bernstein
Alexander C. Berg
Li Fei-Fei
dcterms:description: ImageNet is a large-scale dataset containing over 14 million images categorized into over 20,000 categories. It is widely used for training deep learning models for image classification and object detection.
dcterms:title: ImageNet

dcterms:creator: Alex Krizhevsky
Geoffrey Hinton
dcterms:description: Noisy CIFAR-10 is a corrupted version of the CIFAR-10 dataset where some of the training labels have been randomly flipped. It is used to study the robustness of models to label noise.
dcterms:title: Noisy CIFAR-10
